sentences.en: A passer - by called the emergency services ( = the ambulance / fire / police services ).
sentences.cn: 一名 路人 拨打了紧急救险服务电话.

sentences.en: An ambulance inched its way through the crowd.
sentences.cn: 救护车在人群中缓慢前进。

sentences.en: Do you think we need to call an ambulance (= phone to ask an ambulance to come ) ?
sentences.cn: 你觉得我们需要叫救护车吗？

sentences.en: He was crying out in pain on the ground when the ambulance arrived.
sentences.cn: 救护车赶到时他正疼得在地上大叫。

sentences.en: He was sent to hospital by ambulance.
I was close by as Lester was stretchered into the ambulance.
sentences.cn: 莱斯特被用担架抬进救护车时我就在旁边。

sentences.en: Mary heard the penetrating bell of an ambulance.
sentences.cn: 玛丽听到了刺耳的救护车警铃声。

sentences.en: The ambulance landed him in a hospital.
sentences.cn: 救护车把他送到了医院.
你觉得我们需要叫救护车吗？

sentences.en: The ambulance sped to the hospital.
The first I knew about it was when I woke up in the ambulance.
sentences.cn: 当我从救护车中苏醒过来时才知道发生了什么事。

sentences.en: The two ambulance attendants quickly put Plover on a stretcher and got him into the ambulance.
sentences.cn: 两名救护人员迅速地将普洛弗放到担架上抬进救护车里。

sentences.en: They helped her into the ambulance.
They took the injured away in an ambulance.
sentences.cn: 他们用救护车把受伤的人运走.

sentences.en: We gave the gate money to the St John Ambulance brigade.
sentences.cn: 我们将门票收入都捐给了圣约翰急救队。

sentences.en: We got an ambulance and rushed her to hospital.
sentences.cn: 我们叫了一辆救护车，赶紧把她送到了医院。

trans.tran_en: a special vehicle that is used to take people who are ill or injured to hospital
